etymology.description: Pictogram of a pottery vessel -> stylized as a cauldron
etymology.interpretation: 鬲(lì, "cauldron") is a pictogram representing a pottery vessel or cauldron used in ancient cooking practices. It visually depicts the shape of an ancient pot, emphasizing its use in cooking and ceremonies.

examples.chinese: 考古学家在遗址中发现了一个古老的鬲(考古學家在遺址中發現了一個古老的鬲)。
examples.pinyin: Kǎogǔ xuéjiā zài yízhǐ zhōng fāxiàn le yīgè gǔlǎo de lì。
examples.english: Archaeologists discovered an ancient cauldron at the ruins.

examples.chinese: 博物馆展出了古代的鬲(博物館展出了古代的鬲)，说明远古人的生活(說明遠古人的生活)。
examples.pinyin: Bówùguǎn zhǎnchū le gǔdài de lì, shuōmíng yuǎngǔ rén de shēnghuó。
examples.english: The museum displayed an ancient cauldron, which illustrates the life of ancient people.

examples.chinese: 在古代，鬲不仅是烹饪器具(在古代，鬲不僅是烹飪器具)，更是宗教祭祀的重要象征(更是宗教祭祀的重要象徵)。
examples.pinyin: Zài gǔdài, lì bùjǐn shì pēngrèn qìjù, gèng shì zōngjiào jìsì de zhòngyào xiàngzhēng。
examples.english: In ancient times, the cauldron was not only a cooking utensil, but also an important symbol in religious ceremonies.
